metadata.Title: CVE-2016-5412 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
arch/powerpc/kvm/book3s_hv_rmhandlers.S in the Linux kernel through 4.7 onPowerPC platforms, when CONFIG_KVM_BOOK3S_64_HV is enabled, allows guest OSusers to cause a denial of service (host OS infinite loop) by making aH_CEDE hypercall during the existence of a suspended transaction.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5412` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-38.57~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-38.57~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-38.57~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-38.57~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-38.57~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-38.57~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-38.57~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-38.57~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-38.57~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
